articles.author: Howard Schneider, Indradip Ghosh
articles.description: Blame it on economic theory not matching reality, groupthink among forecasters or political partisanship by opponents of the Biden administration, but a year ago much of the U.S. was convinced the country was in a recession or would be soon.
articles.title: Fed, economists make course correction on US recession predictions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Dutch economy has entered a recession as it shrank 0.3% on a quarterly basis in the second quarter, a first estimate published by Statistics Netherlands on Wednesday showed.
articles.title: Dutch economy enters recession as inflation bites

articles.author: Padraic Halpin
articles.description: Bank of Ireland (BIRG.I) has fixed technical problems that affected its services and allowed some customers to withdraw or transfer funds above what was actually in their accounts, it said on Wednesday morning.
articles.title: People rush to ATMs after windfall from Bank of Ireland app glitch

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's new home prices fell for the first time this year in July, the latest in a string of downbeat data that points to a rapid loss in broader economic momentum and underlines the urgency for more bolder policy support to shore up activity.
articles.title: China's new home prices fall for first time this year, dimming economic outlook

articles.author: Davide Barbuscia
articles.description: Bond investors who had positioned portfolios defensively in anticipation of a U.S. recession are adjusting their strategies for a surprisingly resilient economy that will likely keep interest rates higher, longer than they had expected.
articles.title: Analysis: Higher-for-longer rates regime pressures US recession trades

articles.author: Andy Bruce, William Schomberg
articles.description: Worries about persistently high inflation in Britain grew on Wednesday as key measures of price growth monitored by the Bank of England failed to ease in July, despite a sharp drop in the headline inflation rate.
articles.title: UK inflation pressure stays strong despite fall in headline rate

articles.author: Phuong Nguyen, Francesco Guarascio
articles.description: Vietnam's EV champion VinFast (VFS.O) has managed to sell Wall Street on a Nasdaq listing that values the loss-making startup at more than $85 billion, almost twice as much as Ford (F.N) or General Motors (GM.N).
articles.title: Vietnam's VinFast faces stern EV sales test to retain eye-popping valuation

articles.author: Doyinsola Oladipo, Julia Harte, Rich Mckay
articles.description: The incongruous sight of tourists enjoying Maui's tropical beaches while search-and-rescue teams trawl building ruins and waters for victims of the deadliest U.S. wildfire in more than a century has outraged some residents.
articles.title: Maui tourism, an economic mainstay, sparks anger amid fire ruin

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: A container ship set off from Ukraine's Black Sea port of Odesa on Wednesday in a test of Russia's threat to attack shipping after it abandoned a deal last month allowing Ukraine to export grain.
articles.title: Cargo ship leaves Ukrainian port despite Russian threat of attack

articles.author: Anirban Sen
articles.description: Intel (INTC.O) and Israeli contract chipmaker Tower Semiconductor's (TSEM.TA) proposed $5.4 billion deal has been mutually terminated as they were unable to get timely regulatory approvals, the companies said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Intel, Tower terminate $5.4 billion deal over regulatory hurdles
